alert.note: Alert for Northwest Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 6:29PM EST until January 10 at 2:20PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Maryland... Seneca Creek at Dawsonville affecting Northwest Montgomery zone. For the Seneca Creek...including Dawsonville...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Seneca Creek at Dawsonville. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night to early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Portions of the Seneca Creek Greenway are flooded. A small portion of Berryville Road west of Darnestown begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:50 PM EST Monday the stage was 2.4 feet, or 5.1 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 7.5 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Tue Tue Tue Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1AM 7AM 1PM Stg Time Date Seneca Creek Dawsonville 7.5 2.4 Mon 5 pm 2.3 2.2 2.5 7.9 7am Wed &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM EST.
